meanings.definition: The position or period of being a ruler.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, rulerships were often passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The rulerships of kings and queens are filled with responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The rulerships of the land were decided by a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: Her rulerships over the classroom were firm but fair.
meanings.sent5: The rulerships of the past were marked by grand ceremonies and lavish feasts.

meanings.definition: The authority or power of a ruler.
meanings.sent1: The rulerships of the council were challenged by the rebellious townsfolk.
meanings.sent2: His rulerships extended over vast lands and many people.
meanings.sent3: The rulerships of the principal were questioned by the mischievous students.
meanings.sent4: She wielded her rulerships with grace and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The rulerships of the emperor were absolute and unquestioned.

meanings.definition: The territory or domain over which a ruler holds sway.
meanings.sent1: The rulerships of the kingdom stretched from the mountains to the sea.
meanings.sent2: His rulerships included lush forests and fertile valleys.
meanings.sent3: The rulerships of the backyard were fiercely contested by the rival squirrels.
meanings.sent4: She explored the rulerships of her imagination with boundless creativity.
meanings.sent5: The rulerships of the ancient empire were marked by magnificent architecture and bustling markets.
